text: what a tricks point never rappelled yeah
hi everyone Anthony Fantino here the
Internet's busiest music nerd and it's
time for an album view OneNote Rick's
point never replicas but I'm just going
to refer to the project as OPN from now
on because that's easier replica is the
latest album to come out of this project
spearheaded by producer Daniel low
patent past records have contained a lot
of ambient interludes and sound scapes
and and the kind of synthesizer worship
that could probably get any tangerine
dream fan all excited and this new album
definitely marks a change for Daniel he
is still sticking to his roots in
abstract music in ambient music and
sound scapes but the tools that he's
using now are different there's piano on
here and synths on here a little noise
and tons of effects various reverbs and
such but the surprise guest on this
album is samples sampling sampler San
San San San temple dimple dimple dimple
chicka chicka chicka chicka Tara
replica is an album that is heavily
indebted to the art of sampling and it
really changes opions compositional
style instead of dealing with individual
notes or drones or cords or something
like that
OPN is now building tracks with blocks
of sound slivers of looped sounds but
still manages to maintain this soothing
and mostly ambient and thought-provoking
approach and I think because of this
this creative an interesting mix of of
synthesizer worship and ambient music
and sampling this album kind of ends up
pushing boundaries in the art of
sampling music and maybe inadvertently
because when OPN was putting this album
together I don't think he was thinking
of artists such as as Stein ski or the
Dust Brothers or DJ shadow or
avalanches or the books or Matt mousse
or Girl Talk
or any number of other plunder phonics
or collage music artists but with all
these sound clips that that from what I
understand come from television ads
replicas ends up being an album that
that stands out pretty boldly whether
you measure it up against ambient albums
or plunder phonics collage music albums
genres aside there are 10 tracks on this
album that are very beautiful haunting
and perplexing and it all starts with a
very airy drone just kind of hanging
suspended in the atmosphere it's very
mind-altering for me and not too unlike
what OPN usually does there all sorts of
wandering and very gorgeous synthesized
tones floating throughout the track and
as the song progresses these very quiet
quiet loops and just samples start
popping up just adding more texture and
Drive and tempo to it's like these
ghosts noises start haunting the
soundscape and it really kind of puts me
in another place sonically now the
second track is where the samples really
kick in and originally it was my least
favorite track on the album and now it's
one of my favorites the way the the
loops have been chopped on this
particular track on a lot of tracks on
this LP felt really obnoxious and maybe
sort of lazy to me at first but once I
was able to kind of hear past the fact
that I'm listening to loops I was
getting into the tempo and I was hearing
the detail that is loaded into this song
in particular behind the sampling
because as the track progresses I'm
hearing a lot of sounds that that to me
are a little difficult to describe
because I don't completely understand or
know what they are I'm hearing some
flutes I think and various effects
bouncing off of one another lots of
different synth
textures it's a very intriguing track
the track child soldier is really choppy
as well but it throws even more detail
into the mix with this manipulated
chopped and looped singing all of these
synthesizers some of them kind of airy
and light some of them very noisy and
just squawking it's like all this chaos
set against this very sharp rhythm an
eerie singing loops it's kind of like
hearing this beautiful thing it built up
and then smashed into a thousand pieces
there are more tracks on here though
like the first track where Opie ends
more ambient side intertwines with these
samples like tracks such as explain or
remember but I think it all comes
together best on the song power of
persuasion all these really shuffling
piano loops repeat over and over and
over and it creates a really kind of
tense and eerie and pretty atmosphere
and it all kind of gives me this mix of
different emotions that that feels weird
but you know kind of keeps me on the
edge of my seat and the sense swelling

kind of feel like like trumpets and
tubas Calicut it just swells like a horn

delicately the song really grows into a

like that too but the noisier samples

is what's stealing the show here and
these very somber chords are just kind
of getting cocooned by synthesizers as
the track progresses very slowly
lots of fluttering synths and buzzing

that to me come off as is very
imaginative overall this album to me
feels like a little bit of a mixed bag
you've got tracks that feel like they're
they're nothing but samples and then
you've got moments that that feel like
there are no samples at all is just kind
of like a synth drone and while
stylistically you do get kind of a range
of ideas on this album I feel like
emotion
all these ideas end up coming from
roughly the same place which at the end
of the day kind of makes this album feel
pretty cohesive to me me me now there
are a few negatives a couple a couple
negatives for me for one close
inspection reveals that working with
samples can be really fun exciting and
kind of invigorating as far as finding
new sounds when you're trying to compose
a song based on samples lots of
questions can come up like how do I
introduce this new sound how do I swap
this sound out for another sound while
you know not really losing the pace or
the feel of the song how do I develop
this how do I change this other thing
samples sometimes are really not all
that malleable because of that there are
moments on this LP that kind of lazily
rely on fade-ins and fade-outs because
introducing a sample or getting rid of a
sample it doesn't really seem like
there's a better way to do it and there
are some spots on here where some ideas
and sometimes entire songs just kind of

sort of seems like they've hit the dead
end the track remember feels like that
to me in the song up which has a really
great introduction and a really great
end just has kind of like these two
different parts at the end it's starting
its finish but these two sections just
like crossfade really sloppily into one
another at the midpoint of the song
which really kind of kills the flavor of
it tracks like these to me just don't
showcase the same amount of detail and
grace that a lot of tracks on here do
but outside of that I am loving the
